dt: {bc}a group problem-solving technique that involves the spontaneous contribution of ideas from all members of the group
{bc}the mulling over of ideas by one or more individuals in an attempt to devise or find a solution to a problem

dt.t: … he's already done some {wi}brainstorming{/wi} about new marketing strategies.

shortdef: a group problem-solving technique that involves the spontaneous contribution of ideas from all members of the group; also : the mulling over of ideas by one or more individuals in an attempt to devise or find a solution to a problem

dt: {bc}to try to solve a problem or come up with new ideas by having a discussion that includes all members of a group {bc}to discuss a problem or issue and suggest solutions and ideas

dt.t: Students from Paris, Milan, Tokyo, and New York were invited to the Cambridge campus to {wi}brainstorm{/wi} with MIT students on the marriage of couture and computer.
Engineers are only beginning to {wi}brainstorm{/wi} possible reasons that Polar Lander might have kept silent.

utxt.t: In fact, the speakers joined the attendees as collaborative {wi}brainstormers{/wi} in an exercise to find solutions to some truly global problems …

shortdef: to try to solve a problem or come up with new ideas by having a discussion that includes all members of a group : to discuss a problem or issue and suggest solutions and ideas
